message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.DB, cs.LG

The paper proposes a framework for secure and private data sharing among smart vehicles in smart cities using blockchain technology. This involves addressing issues of privacy, integrity, resilience, and non-repudiation. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also involves network emulation, which suggests it could belong to cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Additionally, the proposed framework involves a decentralized and tamper-resistant architecture, which could fall under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also proposes a design for fast addition of data to blocks, which could be related to cs.DB (Databases). Finally, the paper presents an evaluation of the proposed framework, which could be related to cs.LG (Machine Learning).
